ğ—¥ğ˜‚ğ˜€ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—®-ğ—¨ğ—¸ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—² ğ—ªğ—®ğ—¿: ğ—§ğ—µğ—² ğ—£ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—® ğ—•ğ—¼ğ˜… ğ—¶ğ˜€ ğ—¢ğ—½ğ—²ğ—» The ramifications of this war run much deeper than the impact it will cause to those directly involved in the conflict. It will reshape the world, as it is likely that other latent frictions between countries and territories will be activated as a consequence of the Russia-Ukraine situation. This war just opened an era of wars, small and large, between different peoples. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson recently said that this war could easily become "the biggest war in Europe since 1945", and I agree. If countries with similar backgrounds cannot reach agreement between them, then how much more likely it is that several countries that have big differences and ancient conflicts may easily slip into war for no apparent justifiable reason. On a personal level, it saddens me to see how fate turns around and once again we find ourselves at war. I am sorry and restless since I have many students in Russia and Ukraine who are under threat and feel how the deteriorating situation is affecting them and the whole world. In Israel, too, I have many students who follow with concern what is happening in Eastern Europe, anxious about the fate of their family members and friends. My hope is that the manifestations of hatred between the Russians and the Ukrainians will stop soon, two peoples who have lived side by side throughout history. If it were still possible, I would give everything I could to silence, calm down, avoid the escalation, but this is impossible for now.  There is not much that we can do at this stage. We can only long for peace and a ceasefire, talk about all parties showing restraint. The parties in conflict could follow the example of the Native American tribes who buried their hostility in a ceremony during which previously warring tribes agreed to settle their differences and live in harmony, and sealed their agreement by the chief of each tribe burying a war hatchet in the ground.  Such a scenario does not look realistic under the current circumstances. Thus, above the forces of hostility, above the egoism and control as the driving forces of all the conflicts in the world, we can only raise a global prayer for peace, asking that we all get along with everyone. Because only in the power of connection and in the connection between our hearts, can a great positive force arise, a force that is able to unite all parties, to reconcile the haters, to awaken the truth in us all that we all belong to one soul. As it is written, â€œHe who makes peace in His heights, may He make peace upon usâ€¦â€ (The Book of Job, 25:2)

BRUNO MARS CHRISTMAS SONG 2021 ** Christmas is coming and I'm all alone With no one to snuggle at night. My wineglass is empty to help dull desire To kiss you by soft candlelight.  A rare pearl of value, you don't leave alone Or someone will steal them from you. After they've gone and flown far away It's hard to know just what to do.  I'm watching my neighbors hang lights on their tree With tinsel and striped candy cane. I took you for granted and didn't hug enough And now I must suffer my pain.  Lord, I'm so lonely; I wish I could die Then be born to relive again. I realize the value of someone to love And the danger of my selfish sin.  There's a ring on my phone and a knock at the door Which do I dare go for? If neither is you, I'll break down and cry And again pound my fist on the floor.  I run down the hall and the doorknob turns As the swirling snow rides on the wind. There, in my doorway, it's the face I love Such a beautiful present to send.  Now, I am happy and dancing around With a permanent smile on my face. As children are singing their Christmas love songs And the world is a wonderful place.  THANK YOU FOR WHO YOU ARE IN YOUR HEART ! Can't fathom anyone saying there's lip syncing here man. The improv they make during the song tells it all. It best maybe backing vocals were a track and even that I sincerely doubt. My guess is....bear with me here.....they're just a talented group of guys that put in the work and time to do what they do. Anyone with a musical ear can tell. Even on the studio version you can tell these guys do their parts in one take, their voices aren't layered over each other like crazy, you're not hearing 5 Bruno's between both ears. That or their producer is just insane at mixing and mastering

NASHEEEE\
At my age (64), I was fortunate to have grown up during a period of time that was extremely rich in musical innovation and creativity.  I was even more fortune to have had parents that were entrenched with the music of their era, and so I absorbed Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Sinatra, Ella, etc side by side with the Beatles, the Stones, Led Zepplin, Genesis, and ELP.  And that's just the tip - amazing, ground breaking music was coming from every angle.  Country, disco, pop - there are artists from every genre back then, that are still viable today.    It's obvious that the majority of the current crop of talent does not live up to their predecessors.  I'm not saying that there's no talent out there.  It's just that most of it is very watered down.  It makes sense why that is.  This generation grew up sheltered from experiencing any real disasters.  And we, as a society, are to blame for putting them in this ridiculously safe bubble and trying to create a 'perfect world' where they will never experience any adversity or pain or ever suffer in any way. As a result, people today are hyper-sensitive, have lost all perception of what life is about, can't handle any negativity whatsoever, get offended at the drop of a hat, are way to quick to judge and 'cancel' anyone who makes even the tiniest misstep in this 'perfect' world they are trying to create.  It's really gotten way out of control and the arts are suffering because of it.      Sorry - I got a bit off track, but it leads to my view and admiration of Bruno Mars.  Bruno is such a breath of fresh air!  I equate him to Marvin Gaye and Al Green, of my generation.   I say equate, because Bruno is not a watered down version of these giants - Bruno is one of these giants.  I would say that Bruno surpasses both of them, because he's written and recorded more original songs that have charted high in that genre than either of them did.  Bruno also has the ability to  collaborate with various artists and groups, with the same amount of success.   He took the format of the R&B love song, and, not just respected the premise of how it works, he understands why it works and he fully embraces it.  He did not copy it at all, he built on it, made it his own, refreshed it and brought it to a new generation.  In my humble opinion, because of his songwriting skill, his incredible multi-musical talent, his passion, and the fact that he's created so much music that touches such a broad scope of people, I would put Bruno Mars in the same category as Stevie Wonder.   I'm sorry I won't be around to see it, but I'm sure that people will still be listening to his music, and artists will be covering his songs, 50 years from now.    I'm glad I'm still around to experience and enjoy his talent.  And see a glimmer of hope for the future...

POT FARMER SONG % I got out my pipe stuffed it with pot You better believe it held a whole lot. I whipped out a lighter thumbed up a flame Sucked down that smoke which comforts my brain.  I tried alcohol smoked cigarettes They did nothing but give me regrets. My mom had arthritis could not walk around I rolled her a joint she danced on the ground.  I thought I was losing my lovemaking knack After I smoked some to me it came back. Soon I decided prices were high I searched for some ground I wouldn't have to buy.  I bargained for seeds from smokers all around  Got in my truck and drove out of town. I walked through the woods where wild birds nest  Found me the meadow I thought was the best.  I dug up the ground sowed all my seeds Said a small prayer for strong, healthy weeds. I watered at night with a five-gallon pail  Mosquitoes went hungry for I wore a veil.  Seven months went by; I thought I would die Till the Halloween moon was high in the sky. At night I went out, in a camouflage suit  Used my corn knife to chop down the loot.  I hung it up to dry where it couldnâ€™t be found. Came back and got it, when it had turned brown. I trimmed off the buds, stuffed them in bags Called all my friends and passed out free drags. Okay young folks I was just reading some of the comments below. And I hate to say this but back in the day we really did not care who lead on a SLOW SMOOTH GROOVE! As long as the record sound good you could slow dance with your girl or your guy. Simple, that's all we wanted. We did not pit one lead singer to another. Just wanted to slow dance with our dates. If the GROOVE was good and soulful, you were going to make out that night. Who cares who can hold a tune or pitch longer! I guess some of you still don't get it.

Sensacional  amei ğŸ˜
Just when you think Bruno Mars can't possibly continue creating masterpieces, he comes up with another, another and another. In my opinion, this one, Leave the Door Open, tops them all. This well written and well produced collaboration with Anderson Paak holds its own as an original while it pays homage and tribute to the lush, sexy and sophisticated, classy music arrangements of the Delphonics, The Stylistics, Blue Magic and others responsible for the original Philadelphia Sound. A distinctive sound made possible by music producer and genius Thom Bell (w/Linda Creed in some instances) and Philadelphia International's Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff. But especially Thom Bell who personally painstakingly crafted and created much of its architecture with symphonic strings, horns, that distinctive snare drum hit and other instruments and arrangements not usually found in popular commercial music. Bruno Mars successfully captures the essence of this classic 70's music style, as only Mars can. We all wish his contemporaries in music could also recognize the class, well thought out lyrics and music structure which makes well written and well produced music possible. This is certainly a song you hear once and you'll find yourself listening to over and over again. If you like this song, you've got to revisit, or for some, listen for the first time to some of the original Philly Sound classics which inspired this Bruno Mars masterpiece. Right here on You Tube check out The Delphonics, The Stylistics and Blue Magic. Listen to all of their music but especially Delphonics (Three songs)- Break Your Promise, Ready or Not and For the Love I Gave to You. Stylistics-(Four songs) Hurry Up This Way Again, You Make Me Feel Brand New, Stop, Look Listen and People Make the World Go Round. Blue Magic-(3 Songs) Chasing Rainbows, What's Come Over Me and Spell. Mr. Bruno Mars, thanks for not being afraid to set an example and to inspire, teach and show the industry there's a market for and an interest in classy well made music!

LOS COLOMBIANOS DEBERIANOS:1.SACAR A LOS CONGRESISTAS, REPRESENTANTES A LA CAMARA, PRESIDENTE DE LA REPUBLICA GOLOMBIANA, DEL PODEL.2. SI LAS COSAS NO FUNCIONAN POR LOS MEDIOS DEMOCRATICOS, DEVERIANOS  FORMAR OTRA REPUBLICA INDEPENDIENTE DISTINTA A LA DE COLOMBIA(DEJANDO EXCLUIDOS A CIUDADES COMO BOGOTA Y MEDELLIN):(POR SER CENTROS DEL CONTROL POLITICO, DIRECTAMENTE REPONSABLE DE LOS PROBLEMAS SOCIALES Y ECONOMICOS DEL PAIS)VENTAJAS DE FORMAR OTRA REPUBLICA INDEPENDIENTE DISTINTA A LA DE COLOMBIA(DEJANDO EXCLUIDOS A CIUDADES COMO BOGOTA Y MEDELLIN):(POR SER CENTROS DEL CONTROL POLITICO, DIRECTAMENTE REPONSABLE DE LOS PROBLEMAS SOCIALES Y ECONOMICOS DEL PAIS)  COMO CREAR UNA REPUBLICA INDEPENDIENTE ECONOMICAMENTE:      1 TRNSITO DEL PESO COLOMBIANO:    decir dejar de utilizar el peso, esto obligarÃ­a a que este se devaluara en el mercado,  generando un efecto domino en el aumento de la deuda publica internacional en dÃ³lares para bogota y MedellÃ­n. jurÃ­dicamente no tendrÃ­amos por que pagar una deuda que hicimos los ciudadanos,  el aumento en el costo de vida para los que hacen parte de bancada del gobierno seria enorme. tambiÃ©n si tenemos en cuenta los problemas de desabastecimiento para ese Colombia (bogota ,MedellÃ­n), eso debido a dÃ©ficit para autoabastecerse(aumento de la demanda) generarÃ­a un adicional aumento de precios, sumÃ©mosle el costo del combustible al tener que importarlo. esto obligarÃ­a esos gobernantes a perder capital y aumentar su deuda publica internacional y  a disminuir su calificaciÃ³n como paÃ­s en mal condiciÃ³n econÃ³mica y alto riesgo, esto aria que los inversiones internacionales disminuyan, al igual que las entidades internacionales dispuestas a correr el riesgo de emprestar capital. nuestra nueva moneda deberÃ­a de preservar estabilidad econÃ³mico como estado independiente y ya que contamos con tierras y alimento como poblaciÃ³n del nuevo paÃ­s deberÃ­a de ser factible generar una balanza comercia positiva. aumentando nuestro valor de la moneda si somos cuidados, con los ingresos por exportaciones. 2 PODREMOS CREAR NUESTRA PROPIA REFORMA TRIBUTARIA: una en la cual se quiten por completo los impuestos a las pequeÃ±as y medianas empresas, esto generarÃ­a: el aumento de las empresas nacionales e internacionales y por ende una mayor cantidad y calidad de empleo en sus habitantes. se reduciria el hoy llamado impuesto a la canasta familiar al 10%  esto aumentarÃ­a la capacidad de comprar del trabajador permitiÃ©ndonos tener una mayor capacidad adquisitiva .  aumentarÃ­amos los impuestos a las importaciones al 10%  de algunos productos no necesarios para la poblaciÃ³n de la nueva republica.  3 PODRIANOS DEJAR EL SALARIO DE NUESTROS  GOBERNANTES: POR EJEMPLO , QUE EL SALARIO DE ESTOS NO SUPEREN LOS 2 SALARIOS MINIMOS. 4. PODRIANOS IMPLANTAR LA PENA DE MUERTE PARA LOS CORRUPTOS, ASESINOS, VIOLADORES. 5.MODIFICACION Y CREACION DE UN SERVICIO MILITAR OBLIGATORIO: ESTE SERVICIO APLICARIA PARA HOMBRES Y MUJERES, SERIA EL EQUIVALENTE HACER TRABAJO SIN REMUNERACION PARA LA CONTRUCCION DE PUENTES CARRETERAS, CALLES, VIAS, LIMPIEZA  DE PLAYAS, PARQUES,  ESE YIPO DE FUNCIONES BAJO LA SUPERVICION DE ALGUIEN CAPACITADO DE LA POLICIA.(ESTA CLASE DE NORMA, REDUCE EL GASTO PUBLICO Y MEJORA LAS FINANZAS INTERNAS, PERMITIENDONOS TENER DINERO PARA APOYAR LA EDUCACION PRIMARIA, SEGUNDARIA, TECNICA Y UNIVERSITARIA( ESTO ASU VES, AUMENTARIA LA TASA DE ALFABETIZACION, REDUCCION DE INDICE DE VIOLENCIA, AUMENTO DE LA SEGURIDAD INTERNA, AUMENTO DE LA CALIDAD DE VIDA ELIMINACION DE GUERRILLAS Y PARAMILITARES POR FALTA DE OPORTUNIDADES DEJANDO MEJOR MARGEN DE MANEJO ECONOMICO DEVIDO A QUE NECESITARIANOS MENOS POLICIAS Y INTEGRANTES DEL EJERSITO REDUCIENDO EL COSTO EN LA GUERRA"LOS UNICOS NO VENEFICIADOS SERIAN LOS RUSOS  YA QUE LA MAYORIA DE LAS ARMAS ILEGALES VIENEN DE ESE PAIS"(PERDONENME MIS AMIGOS RUSOS, Y NORTEAMERICANOS PERO PREFIERO LA PAZ Y ESTABILIDAD Y ORDEN ANTES QUE LA VIOLENCIA).))  6. PODRIANOS MODIFICAR LAS FUNCIONES DE NUESTRO EJERCITO Y POLICIA: ejemplo que estos se encarguen  de orientar a los jÃ³venes EN LAS LABORES COMUNITARIAS , tales como el servicio militar obligatorio.   7. PODRIANOS ELIMINAR LOS IMPUESTOS A LAS EXPORTACIONES.(AUMENTANDO LA DEMANDA DE NUESTROS PRODUCTOS Y CLARO LOS EMPLEOS) SI HACEMOS ESTO SEGURO LA NUEVA REPUBLICA SERIA UNA POTENCIA ECONOMICA.

I am so happy to hear the new song. I am especially happy to see how well it is doing out amongst everyone. "Ima leave the door open" puts me in mind of the old school music in the 60s and 70s. Commadores, Earth, Wind and Fire... Etc. Those boys back then knew how to get a crowd moving, just like these guys do. In these hectic and chaotic times, to turn on the radio and hear such a beautiful melody of music and the lyrics playful, light and sexually charged... You can't listen to that song and think of anything but who you are watching perform. Mr. Bruno Mars, you are now and forever will be brilliant. You outshine the brightest of all stars in my eyes, your partner, Mr. Paak, very gifted as well. Your "Silk Sonic" as a collaborative effort... Got your pockets going jing-a-ling, all women want you, and all men want to be you! Not to shabby.

Magicalâœ¨
I hope this performance can show the rest of my generation just how good a live performance can be. The studio recording of this track is great by itself, but I think the more soulful nature of this live performance would persuade nine out of ten people into choosing this sort of live sound over the studio song. I just really love the art of live music performance and wish others could be exposed to that sort of sound more than they are these days. So, imagine if the studio version of this song had been recorded like an old Motown record instead of like a modern, spotless hip hop/pop song. It would be about a million times better than it already is, IMO. These guys are so damn talented that it is an absolute SHAME (and even insulting to them) that their tracks get processed and auto-tuned/gridded to death in the studio. I mean, give me the real human emotion of a live performance like this over a robotic, computer studio-perfect track any day of the week.   I just feel like so many other 20-somethings like me don't even realize what they're missing when it comes to the slight imperfections in music that make it feel more human. Virtually everyone agrees that this version of the song is better than the studio version, so what can we do to make other people realize that this is the sort of thing we want? We gotta demand that real, sometimes imperfect artistry and emotion in studio songs becomes OK again. It is time for the imperfect sound of prime era soul records to make a comeback in this soulless world of ours. Let this be an example of how things could be in the realm of popular music. Studio perfect music with every note perfectly in tune and every beat right on the grid DOES NOT equal better music. All that does is kill the soul of a song. Please bring some humanity back into popular music and make music "imperfect" again!!!

Moments of genuine harmonic surprise:  0:20 this chord is a G/F which is functioning as a spicy version of a G7 (the V chord)  0:55 an abrupt and fantastic modulation up a minor 3rd to the key of Eb  1:04 this Gsus7 (F/G) to get back to our original key of C   1:08 the delayed resolution of landing on the tonic  1:28 when we finally land on the tonic for the first time in the song it's just absolutely explosive and feels amazing to hear  1:31 this resolution is followed by a chord that is easily the spiciest, jazziest and most heartwrenching chord I've ever heard in any song by a mainstream musical artist. An A7(b9, b13). I'm just in love with silk sonic now.  2:00 back to the B section in Eb  2:10 this Gsus7 somehow manages to hit harder the second time around  2:36 this chord again. holy fuck I love it.  2:39 here we continue the progression by changing keys again to Eb  2:43 we get this Gsus7 again implying a short key change back to C  2:39-2:52 we get this two-chord vamp that jumps from Eb to C by means of the chords Abmaj9 and Gsus7. the Abmaj9 can also be thought of as the b6 in the key of C.  2:52 this two-chord vamp jumps down a whole-step so that we can modulate up a half-step to Db 2:59 we modulate by means of a ii7-Vsus7  3:04 rather than completing the ii7-Vsus7 by resolving to a Imaj7, we delay the resolution by going back to our progression from the verses (IVmaj7, V7, iii7, vi7)   3:38-4:16 here we get this amazing chord progression. Dbmaj7, Bb7(b9,b13), Amaj9, Absus7. This chord progression is absolutely sublime and makes me feel all the feelings.  This analysis doesn't serve this song enough justice because I'm absolutely speechless. As a jazz musician, I never expect anything of this caliber of music theory or musical complexity. I'm so excited to see where this duo goes next. Hopefully, this will bring back musical complex to popular music. Thanks for reading. I'm gonna go now. Bye.

There is no doubting Bruno's talent, but he is also a true professional.  Artists at Bruno's level oftend create a bunch of garbage when they collaborate with other artists. Examples of that are anything by Michael Jackson and Paul McCartney, and the Mars, Sheehan, Stapleton suprisingly bad song, "Blow". Usually, when Bruno collaborates with other artists it works out really well, like this duet. It just reminds us to be grateful of the era Bruno grew up in, his early origins in the family band, and his genuine appreciation classic soul music. His voice and Paak's sound great together. This is 70's R & B at its finest..........Check out those suits.........
Somewhere, Luther, Michael, Aretha, Prince and Whitney are smiling, giving each other Hi-Fives along with David Ruffin, Eddie Kendricks, Levi Stubbs, Gerald Levert and my recently departed mother, who joined them in heaven last year (She would have loved this...). And the Spinners, O'Jays, Dramatics, Delphonics, Stylistics, Blue Magic, Four Tops and Temptations, while patting themselves on the back for their showmanship and artful choreography while SANGIN' ,  are saying "THEY'RE  FINALLY STARTING TO GET IT."  My God, What a timeless treat!!!!  If this is a preview of the forthcoming  "An Evening With Silk Sonic" collaboration with Bruno Mars, Anderson Paak and Bootsy Collins (There it is...), this might be HUGE, as big as that 1980's era of albums where GRAMMYS WERE EARNED WITH TALENT as opposed to gimmicks. And what's frighteningly beautiful about this is the Live version sounds better than the incredible studio version. It really places focus on Bruno and Anderson's voices and they knock it out park. That harmony at song's end simultaneously brings tears and chills. Putting the music industry on notice, this might be the best group ballad recorded since BOYZ II MEN soulfully sang END OF THE ROAD, and I PERSONALLY THINK IT'S BETTER. You can tell by the chemistry between the two that they wanted us to EXPERIENCE this, not just merely LISTEN. I pray this song gets EVERYTHING IT TRULY DESERVES. - William Fredrick Cooper

just listened again and got chills... again
I don't know what people are talking about when they say he's culturally appropriating. I'm a black man, growing up I listened to Michael Mcdonald/D.B's, Bobby Caldwell, Hall &Oates and I remember my parents and relatives (all black except for an aunt) rockin' to their music and were happy to claim some funky white dudes as their own. We also listened to  The Temps, The Whispers (my favorite), Stylistics, Delphonics, Sly and the Family.. etc..  I have yet to see anyone emulate these greats but only a few. Bruno Mars is one of them. I see him as a person who grew up listening to and loving the same music as I did and he's doing this so we don't forget about an era known for putting out the music that everyone samples, the music that shaped many of today's stars, the music that played in the background as our parents fell in love with each other. Music with a real BAND! What I consider REAL MUSIC... Thanks for keeping beautiful music alive Bruno Mars and Anderson .Paak.
I adore this!

Take note all you modern day pop artists, this is how real music is done. Real instruments, real voices, perfect synchronization, perfect harmony, perfect breaks, and clear & obvious passion in performing what they crafted from the bottom up live. No lip syncs, no sung over pre-records, no beat from some electronic device you paid another producer big money for to lay down garbage vocals ya half-wrote. Good for you if you can make money and get the views for the short time your songs are in rotation, but music like this lasts forever and will still be played long after we are dead.
